availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George A. Patterson (Trigg County, Kentucky, schoolteacher and minister.)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, schoolteacher and minister. Virginia native. Married to Margaret Carloss Patterson in Trigg County, Kentucky, on September 14, 1837. Father of Ann O. Patterson, Susan E. Patterson, Henrietta V. Patterson, John W. Patterson, George W. Patterson, James J. Patterson, and M.E. Patterson. Schoolteacher in Trigg County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1850. Minister in Trigg County in 1860. Owned ten enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 2, p. 353A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, p. 133.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, p. 384B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz Precinct, p. 6A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994056, Trigg County Births.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Trigg County Marriages, Film 000321335.
David Sumner, Kim Fortner, Pam Metts, and Charles Morris, Cemeteries of Cadiz and Trigg County, Kentucky (Sumforme Publishing, 2008), 276.
